import { InputTime } from '@looker/components'
import { Editor, excludedProps } from '@looker/storybook'
import { ArgsTable, Meta } from '@storybook/addon-docs'
import basicStory from '!!raw-loader!./Basic'
import timeFormattingStory from '!!raw-loader!./TimeFormatting'
import controlledStory from '!!raw-loader!./Controlled'
import defaultValueStory from '!!raw-loader!./DefaultValue'
import disabledStory from '!!raw-loader!./Disabled'
import readOnlyStory from '!!raw-loader!./ReadOnly'
import withLabelStory from '!!raw-loader!./WithLabel'
import focusBlurStory from '!!raw-loader!./FocusBlurEvents'
import validationErrorStory from '!!raw-loader!./ValidationError'
import onValidationFailStory from '!!raw-loader!./OnValidationFail'

<Meta component={InputTime} title="Docs/InputTime" />

# InputTime

`InputTime` provides a themable HTML5-equivalent time picking experience.

<Editor code={basicStory} />

## 12 And 24 Hour Format

`InputTime` can display either a 12-hour or 24-hour time selecting interface. If not specified, it defaults to 12-hour time.

<Editor code={timeFormattingStory} />

## Controlled Component

`InputTime` accepts a value and onChange listener for the standard controlled component pattern.

<Editor code={controlledStory} />

## defaultValue

`InputTime` also accetpts a `defaultValue` prop if you don't want to control component value externally.

<Editor code={defaultValueStory} />

## disabled

Use the disable property to make an input field uneditable.

<Editor code={disabledStory} />

## readOnly

As the name suggests, `readOnly` makes the text uneditable.

<Editor code={readOnlyStory} />

## ID & Form Labels

You can combine the `id` prop with form label, so that when the label is clicked it will focus on the `hour` input.

<Editor code={withLabelStory} />

## Focus & Blur Events

`onFocus` callback will fire when any of the three sub-fields (hour, minute, period) are focused. `onBlur` fires when the focus moves outside the component entirely.

<Editor code={focusBlurStory} />

## Validation Error State

You can render a failed validation state with the prop `validationType="error"`.

<Editor code={validationErrorStory} />

## onValidationFail

In addition, `InputTime` will automatically check whether the provided `value` prop is actually a valid 24 hour time string, and fire the `onValidationFail` callback.

<Editor code={onValidationFailStory} />

## Props

<ArgsTable of={InputTime} exclude={excludedProps} />
